headline: Analysts Expect This S&P 500 Leader To Deliver Good Outlook
summary: FedEx shares extended their new year rally Tuesday after two analysts upgraded the delivery heavyweight ahead of its investor day.  Wells Fargo upgraded FedEx to buy from hold and made a big increase in the price target, to 380 from 295.  Wells Fargo expects FedEx to issue "solid" multiyear financial targets at the company's investor day Feb. 12, and the next fiscal year could be much better for profits.

headline: Veho to flex delivery speed for price-sensitive e-commerce sellers
summary: Veho is offering e-commerce shippers a way to reduce costs so they can offer free shipping if they are willing to accept day-range certainty instead of a day-definite delivery, in effort to differentiate themselves from other independent parcel carriers. The post Veho to flex delivery speed for price-sensitive e-commerce sellers appeared first on FreightWaves.

headline: Buy FedEx Stock Ahead of Its Analyst Day, Wells Fargo Says
summary: Analyst Christian Wetherbee raised his rating to Buy from Hold and took his price target to $380 a share from $295.

headline: Robert Kiyosaki Says When Walmart Has A Sale, Poor People Buy Everything. When The Market Crashes, They Sell. The Rich Do The Opposite
summary: “Rich Dad, Poor Dad” author Robert Kiyosaki has once again stirred up conversation with his frank take on why rich and poor people approach money so differently. “When Walmart has a SALE poor people rush in and buy, buy, buy,” Kiyosaki wrote in a recent post on X. “Yet when the Financial Asset Market has a sale…a.k.a.…..CRASH… the poor sell and run….while the rich rush in….and buy, buy, buy.” Crash Mindset Vs. headline: ’Stock has room to run’: Analysts upgrade FedEx ahead of investor day, shares up
summary: Investing.com -- FedEx Corporation shares drew fresh support from Wall Street this week as two brokerages upgraded the stock ahead of the company’s investor day next week, pointing to improving parcel fundamentals, margin recovery at Express and upside tied to the planned Freight spin.

headline: 'It Is Not Ready For Prime Time Yet,' FedEx CEO Raj Subramaniam Says—Even As He Pushes 'Super Humanoid Robots' And AI For 17M Daily Deliveries
summary: Warehouse robots and artificial intelligence are moving fast through logistics, but one major delivery company is slowing down. FedEx (NYSE:FDX) is expanding its use of AI across a global network while taking a cautious approach to warehouse robotics and drones, CEO Raj Subramaniam recently told The New York Times. Subramaniam said shipping and logistics giant FedEx handles roughly $2 trillion in global commerce annually, calling the company "the heartbeat of the industrial economy," with about
